instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message: First it came in with water dmg to display connector, no image at internal, but external working. Now after repairing connector and changed screen flex board boots fine to os, shows apple logo, but after boots to os display goes black. I tryed safe mode boot, everything works. But normal boot no display after boot os

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message:
Looks like GPU issue.
Its driver is not loaded in safe mode.
Just in case, change <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>.
If still the same, may try changing <CHIP>U9801</CHIP>/10/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message: it cant be gpu issue because external monitor booting and everything okay, just internal goes black when os start

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message:
Check the <SIGNAL>LID_ANGLE_SENSOR_ND</SIGNAL>/MGL.
Should be lid sensor problem.

Disconnect J4802 and check if maintains image into macOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message: Can you post voltage level for mentioned signals?
